question: A and B together can complete a piece of work in 18 days, B and C in 24 days and A and C in 36 days. In how many days, will all of them together complete the work?
explanation:
(A + B)\'s 1 day\'s work $latex = \\frac{1}{18}&s=1$
(B + C)\'s 1 day\'s work $latex = \\frac{1}{24}&s=1$
(C + A)\'s 1 day\'s work $latex = \\frac{1}{36}&s=1$
On adding, 
2(A + B + C)\'s 1 day\'s work $latex = \\frac{1}{18}+\\frac{1}{24}+\\frac{1}{36} = \\frac{4+3+2}{72} = \\frac{1}{8}&s=1$
∴ (A + B + C)\'s 1 day\'s work $latex = \\frac{1}{16}&s=1$
∴ A, B and C together will complete the work in 16 days.
Hence option [D] is correct answer.
